page.title: 11The Arts in Stowmarket.
page.content: The area can support only rare performances by professional artists and then only if simple facilities are needed. Amateurs use the old "Regal" cinema for plays; it also provides a setting for performances by the Schools Concert Band. School and Church halls are used from time to time for musical or dramatic events. Enthusiasts are well served in Bury St. Edmunds,Ipswich and Cambridge, for drama and and music. The rail-link with London is of great value to people interested in major Art exhibitions. Library facilities used to be very cramped but the recent provision of a new building in the centre of Stowmarket has improved access to a wide range of literature.
